summary: The contact owns a 2019 Jayco Jay Flight. The contact received notification of NHTSA Campaign Number: 12v425000 (Equipment). The contact stated that the dealer had exceeded a reasonable amount of time for the recall repair to become available. The manufacturer was made aware of the issue. The contact stated that the part was not available. The contact had not experienced a failure. Parts Distribution Disconnect.

The contact owns a 2019 Jayco Jay Flight. The contact received notification of NHTSA Campaign Number:  21V425000 (Equipment) however, the part to do the recall repair was unavailable. The contact took the vehicle to the local dealer and it was confirmed that the part was not available. The contact stated that the manufacturer had exceeded a reasonable amount of time for the recall repair. The manufacturer was made aware of the issue. The contact had not experienced a failure. Parts distribution disconnect.

The contact owns a 2019 Jayco Jay Flight RV. The contact received notification of NHTSA Campaign Number: 20E071000 (Equipment) however, the part to do the recall repair was not yet available. The contact stated that the manufacturer had exceeded a reasonable amount of time for the recall repair. The local dealer and the manufacturer were made aware of the issue. The contact had not experienced a failure. Parts distribution disconnect.

The contact owns a 2019 Jayco Jay Flight. The contact received notification of NHTSA campaign number 21V425000 (Equipment) however, the part to do the recall repair was unavailable. The local dealer was contacted, and it was confirmed that the part was not yet available and would not be available for several months. The contact stated that the manufacturer had exceeded a reasonable amount of time for the recall repair. The manufacturer was made aware of the issue. The contact had not experienced a failure. The VIN was not available.

The contact owns a 2019 Jayco J-flight. The contact received notification of NHTSA Campaign Number: 21V184000 (Equipment) however, the part for the recall repair was unavailable. The contact contacted the dealer who confirmed that the parts were ordered however the repair was pushed back several times due to parts not being available. The contact stated the manufacturer exceeded a reasonable amount of time for the recall repair. The manufacturer was made aware of the issue. The contact had stated the vehicle's carbon dioxide and smoke detector sensor had set off indicating that one or both were occurring. There was no actual fire or smoke however there was a fuel like odor that remained in the vehicle. The approximate failure mileage was 200.

The contact owns a 2019 Jayco Jay Flight RV. The contact received notification of NHTSA campaign number: 21V425000 (Equipment) however, the part to do the recall repair was unavailable. The vehicle was taken to the local dealer and it was confirmed that the part was not yet available. The contact stated that the manufacturer had exceeded a reasonable amount of time for the recall repair. The manufacturer was not made aware of the issue. The contact had not experienced a failure. Parts distribution disconnect.

The contact owns a 2019 Jayco Jay Flight trailer. The contact received notification of NHTSA Campaign Number: 21V179000 (Equipment). The dealer was made aware of the recall and informed the contact that the part needed to be ordered for the recall repair. The parts department was not aware if the part was ordered for the recall repair. The contact had not experienced a failure but was concerned about a possible gas leak. The manufacturer was made aware of the issue. Parts distribution disconnect.

On May 24, 2021 we received a notification from Dometic  Corporation in reference to a problem with the stove in our Rv. There is a gas leak in the stove and a remedy kit needs to be attained. The customer has to do pretty much all of the leg work. The stove has to be taken apart to attain the Model and Serial numbers to see if they match from list given.  A picture of the information needs to be emailed along with a form to attained a remedy kit. Info has to be received from the dealer where the work is to be performed and listed on the form .Propane gas can not be used in the rv for other components, such as the refrigerator, water heater and furnace. One of the forms received was dated November 13, 2020. According to Dometic, this is when the problem arose, so we were not notified until 6 and a half months later. In the meantime, we were using our camper.  When asked what compensation will be provide to the customer and the response was "none." When I stated that the customer is doing all the legwork, the response from Dometic was: No, all you have to do is bring it there. This situation has been handled very poorly. It took Dometic 6 and a half months to notify customers because they did not have the parts in stock to fix the issue. Too long !!! And now, according to Dometic, it will be a month beofre the remedy kit is sent to the dealer. Again...too long !!!

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2019 JAYCO JAY FLIGHT. THE CONTACT RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 21V184000 (EQUIPMENT) HOWEVER, THE PART TO DO THE RECALL REPAIR WAS NOT YET AVAILABLE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE MANUFACTURER HAD EXCEEDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR THE RECALL REPAIR. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE ISSUE. THE CONTACT HAD NOT EXPERIENCED A FAILURE. PARTS DISTRIBUTION DISCONNECT.

components: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM,UNKNOWN OR OTHER,ELECTRONIC STABILITY CONTROL
summary: I BOUGHT A 2019 JAYCO JAYFLIGHT, TRAVEL TRAILER, MODEL 29BHDB.    MY SLIDE OUT HAS A MANUFACTURING DEFECT THAT IS ALSO A SAFETY AND A LEGAL ISSUE AS WELL; BECAUSE THE HOLE TO INSERT A CRANK TO MANUALLY OPERATE THE SLIDE SHOULD IT FAIL IS BLOCKED BY THE TANK, SO IF THE SLIDE SHOULD FAIL THERE IS NO WAY TO MANUALLY RETRACT IT, WHICH MEANS THAT I WOULD HAVE TO DRIVE WITH MY SLIDE EXTENDED IF THAT SHOULD HAPPEN, THAT IS A SAFETY ISSUE AND A LEGAL ISSUE BECAUSE IT IS AN OFFENSE TO DRIVE WITH YOUR SLIDE EXTENDED, BUT I WOULD HAVE TO DRIVE TO A REPAIR SHOP TO HAVE THAT FIXED IF I CANNOT RETRACT THE SLIDE MANUALLY.    THAT IS WOULD BE VERY DANGEROUS BECAUSE DRIVING WITH AN EXTENDED SLIDE OUT AFFECTS THE AERODYNAMICS OF YOUR VEHICLE WHILE IN MOTION.     IN 2020 JAYCO DECIDED TO DISCONTINUE THIS MODEL BECAUSE OF THIS DEFECT AND OTHER ISSUES, BUT THEY HAVE REFUSED TO FIX THE DEFECT.    THE TRAVEL TRAILER CAME WITH THE CRANK TO OPERATE THE SLIDE MANUALLY BUT THE HOLE TO ATTACH THE CRANK TO THE CRANK EXTENSION IS BLOCKED BY THE HOLDING TANK.

THERE HAVE BEEN SO MANY ISSUES WITH OUR CAMPER. WE BOUGHT IT BRAND NEW IN MAY OF 2019, IT STARTED HAVING PROBLEMS WHILE STATIONARY IN AUGUST OF 2019 WHEN WATER STARTED LEAKING THROUGH THE ROOF, DAMAGING THE LIGHT FIXTURES, SOAKING OUR RECLINER, AND THE CARPET/FLOOR NEXT TO THE RECLINER. WE TOOK IT TO OCEAN GROVE AND IT WAS THERE FOR 1 MONTH. THEN SHORTLY AFTER THAT THE SHOWER STARTED LEAKING THROUGH THE FLOOR, MULTIPLE TIMES. EVERY TIME THEY SENT SOMEONE OUT, IT WOULD BE FIXED FOR A FEW DAYS, THEN WE'D HAVE TO CALL THEM BACK TO FIX IT. THIS WENT ON AND ON UNTIL THE WATER DAMAGE WAS SO SEVERE THAT IT HAD DAMAGED THE FUZE BOX. RV-ONE (WHO BOUGHT OUT OCEAN GROVE) CAME OUT TO FIX IT ALONG WITH THE FRONT DOOR THAT, NOW, WASN'T SHUTTING OR STAYING CLOSED.  THE CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR WENT OFF IN FEBRUARY OF 2020 TO ADD TO ALL THE OTHER TROUBLES. THEY TOLD US TO BRING IT IN ON FEB. 3RD, 2020. WE BROUGHT THE CAMPER UP TO THEM AND THEY SAID THEY WOULD ORDER THE PARTS ASAP. ON THE WARRANTY CLAIMS IT SAYS THE ORDER WASN'T PLACED UNTIL MARCH 3RD. THEN COVID-19 STARTED HITTING, WHICH DELAYED THEM FROM GETTING PARTS. RV1 HAD OUR CAMPER FOR 5 1/2 MONTHS. THEY CALLED US MAYBE ONCE OR TWICE FOR UPDATES, BUT OTHER THAN THAT WE WERE CONSTANTLY CALLING THEM AND HEARING THE SAME THING OVER AGAIN "YOUR PARTS ARE BEING SHIPPED". WE GOT IT BACK BEGINNING OF JULY AND THEY ARE A HUGE SCRATCH ON THE SIDE AND ACTUALLY TORE UP ONE OF THE TIRE COVERS AND DIDN'T EVEN SAY ANYTHING. WE NOTICED A FEW DAYS AFTER BRINGING IT HOME.
